name: Urgot
title: the Dreadnought
lore: Once a powerful Noxian headsman, Urgot was betrayed by the empire for which he had killed so many. Bound in iron chains, he was forced to learn the true meaning of strength in the Dredge—a prison mine deep beneath Zaun. Emerging in a disaster that spread chaos throughout the city, he now casts an imposing shadow over its criminal underworld. Raising his victims on the very chains that once enslaved him, he will purge his new home of the unworthy, making it a crucible of pain.
blurb: Once a powerful Noxian headsman, Urgot was betrayed by the empire for which he had killed so many. Bound in iron chains, he was forced to learn the true meaning of strength in the Dredge—a prison mine deep beneath Zaun. Emerging in a disaster that...
allytips: Pay attention to your individual leg's cooldowns, as they make for a signficiant portion of your damage
Land Corrosive Charge or Disdain to lock on to target's with Purge - a great way to trigger multiple legs in rapid succession.
Save Fear Beyond Death for opponents you know are already too weak to survive. It's especially good for picking off fleeing foes.
enemytips: Urgot relies heavily on blasting opponents with his legs, which have their own cooldowns and only detonate when he attacks in the direction they are facing. Avoid getting hit by multiple.
Urgot can deal and absorb tremendous amounts of damage with Purge, but slows himself while firing.
If you are struck by Fear Beyond Death, do your best to avoid falling below the execution threshold (25% of your Maximum Health) until the effect times out.

riot_spell_q.name: Corrosive Charge
riot_spell_q.description: Fires an explosive charge at the target location, dealing physical damage and slowing enemies caught in the explosion.
riot_spell_q.tooltip: Urgot fires an explosive charge, dealing {{ e2 }} <scaleAD>(+{{ a1 }})</scaleAD> physical damage and slowing enemies hit by {{ e4 }}% for {{ e5 }} second.

riot_spell_w.name: Purge
riot_spell_w.description: Urgot slows himself while he unloads his weapon on nearby enemies. Prioritizes enemy champions Urgot has recently struck with other abilities and triggers Echoing Flames.
riot_spell_w.tooltip:
For {{ e3 }} seconds, Urgot shoots at a nearby enemy {{ e8 }} times a second, dealing {{ e9 }} (+{{ f3 }}) physical damage per shot, locking onto champions recently damaged by his other abilities.

While firing, Urgot loses {{ e5 }} movement speed but has {{ e2 }}% slow resistance and can walk over minions and non-epic monsters.

At max rank, Purge lasts for an infinite duration and has no cooldown.

Applies on-hits at {{ onhitdamagereduction*100 }}% damage. Cannot critically strike. Minimum of {{ e0 }} damage to minions.

riot_spell_e.name: Disdain
riot_spell_e.description: Urgot charges in a direction, shielding himself and trampling non-champion enemies. If he catches an enemy champion, he will stop and hurl them out of his way.
riot_spell_e.tooltip:
Urgot charges forwards, shielding himself for {{ etotalshieldhealth }} for {{ eshieldduration }} seconds. If he catches an enemy champion, he will stop and hurl them behind him, dealing {{ edamage }} physical damage and stunning them for {{ e6 }} seconds.

Non-champions take the same damage but are knocked aside.

Cannot cross terrain.

riot_spell_r.name: Fear Beyond Death
riot_spell_r.description: Urgot fires a chem-drill that impales the first enemy champion hit. If that champion falls below a health threshold, Urgot judges them weak and can execute them.
riot_spell_r.tooltip:
Urgot fires a chem-drill, impaling the first enemy champion hit. Deals {{ rcalculateddamage }} physical damage and slows for {{ rslowduration }} seconds by up to {{ rmovespeedmod }}% based on the victim's missing health.

If the victim falls below {{ rhealththreshold }}% health while impaled, Urgot may recast this ability, suppressing the victim and dragging them in for execution. Activates automatically if the target is below {{ rhealththreshold }}% at the end of the effect.

When Urgot executes a victim, nearby enemies flee in terror for {{ rfearduration }} seconds.

riot_spell_i.name: Echoing Flames
riot_spell_i.description: Urgot's basic attacks and Purge periodically trigger blasts of flame from his legs, dealing physical damage.

wikia_skill_i1.name: Echoing Flames
wikia_skill_i1.blurb: Urgot's basic attacks and Purge periodically trigger blasts of flame from his legs, dealing physical damage.
wikia_skill_i1.description: {{sbc|Innate:}} '''Urgot's''' six legs each conceal a shotgun that covers an arc, together forming a full circle of cover around him. Each shotgun has one shell and an individual reload timer.
wikia_skill_i1.description2: The next basic attack [[on-hit]] in the direction and range of a ''loaded'' shotgun causes it to fire, instantly dealing {{as|{{pp|6|key=%|40 to 100|1;6;9;11;13;15}} AD}} {{as|(+ {{pp|5|changedisplay=true|key=%|2 to 6|1;6;9;11;13}} of target's '''maximum''' health)}} {{as|physical damage}} to enemies in a cone, up to {{pp|60 to 360}} against monsters.
wikia_skill_i1.customlabel: {{tt|Per-Leg Cooldown|This is not affected by cooldown reduction}}
wikia_skill_i1.notes:
* ''Echoing Flames'':
** Will not trigger while {{tip|Blind|blinded}} or if the basic attack is blocked by {{cai|Wind Wall|Yasuo}}.
** Will not trigger versus wards.
** Will trigger from {{iis|Runaan's Hurricane}} additional bolts.
** Will not apply {{sti|life steal}}, but {{sti|spell vamp}} at 33% effectiveness.
** Will apply [[spell effect]]s.
** When basic attacking certain units (e.g {{cai|Jack in the Box|Shaco}}), ''Echoing Flames'' does not trigger, however it will trigger when attacking them with {{ai|Purge|Urgot}}.
* '''Urgot's''' legs never change in orientation, with his body instead rotating on top of them - i.e. the leg that faces north will always face north. This does not affect '''Urgot's''' facing direction for the purposes of abilities such as {{ai|Petrifying Gaze|Cassiopeia}}.

wikia_skill_q1.name: Corrosive Charge
wikia_skill_q1.blurb: Fires an explosive charge at the target location, dealing physical damage and slowing enemies caught in the explosion.
wikia_skill_q1.description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Urgot''' launches a canister at the target location that explodes after {{fd|0.6}} seconds, dealing {{as|physical damage}} and {{tip|slow|slowing}} all enemies hit for 1 second.

wikia_skill_w1.name: Purge
wikia_skill_w1.blurb: Urgot shields himself, slowing himself while he unloads his weapon on nearby enemies. Prioritizes enemy champions Urgot has recently struck with other abilities and triggers Echoing Flames.
wikia_skill_w1.description: {{sbc|Passive:}} '''Urgot's''' other abilities apply '''''{{as|Purge|buzzword2}}''''' to enemy champions for 5 seconds. Only one enemy champion can be marked at a time.
wikia_skill_w1.description2: {{sbc|Active:}} For 4 seconds, '''Urgot''' is {{tip|ghosted}}, gains 40% {{stil|slow resist}} and autonomously [[basic attack]]s the nearest enemy at {{sti|attack speed|{{as|{{fd|3.0}} attack speed}}}}, prioritizing enemy champions marked for '''''{{as|Purging|buzzword2}}''''', refreshing the mark with every attack. He can keep attacking without interrupting his movement, but while firing his {{as|'''base''' movement speed}} is reduced by 125.
wikia_skill_w1.description3: Attacks deal modified damage, down to a minimum of 50 damage against minions, with only 50% [[on-hit]] damage and cannot {{tip|critically strike}}.
wikia_skill_w1.description4: After {{tt|{{fd|0.5}}|Estimated}} seconds, '''Urgot''' can reactivate ''Purge'' to end all effects.
wikia_skill_w1.description5: At maximum rank, ''Purge'' lasts indefinitely and becomes a toggled ability.
wikia_skill_w1.notes:
* ''Purge'' can be cast during other abilities.
* At maximum rank, ''Purge'' still has a static cooldown of 1 second between 2 activation, even though the cooldown is marked at 0 seconds.
* Before maximum rank, if continuously attacking without interrupting or canceling the cast, '''Urgot''' will shoot 13 attacks.
* The bolts are considered basic attacks and thus apply {{sti|life steal}}. The lifesteal is applied at full efficiency.
* '''Urgot's''' attack commands during ''Purge'' instead issue movement commands.
* The reduction in base movement speed by ''Purge'' is not affected by slow resistance.
* Percentage {{tip|slow|slows}} apply after the flat movement reduction.
* Using {{cis|Urgot}} ''other abilities'' will extend the duration of ''Purge'' briefly to compensate for the animation time.
* ''Purge'' will apply {{ii|Runaan's Hurricane}} on every shot at 100% of the listed damage.
** On hit effects applied by {{ii|Runaan's Hurricane}} are reduced to 50% damage.
* '''Urgot''' will not attack during the cast times of his other abilities.

wikia_skill_e1.name: Disdain
wikia_skill_e1.blurb: Urgot charges in a direction, trampling non-champion enemies. If he catches an enemy champion, he will stop and hurl them out of his way.
wikia_skill_e1.description2: After {{fd|0.25}} seconds, '''Urgot''' {{tip|dash|dashes}} in the target direction, though not through terrain, dealing {{as|physical damage}} to all enemies in the way and {{tip|airborne|knocking them aside}}.
wikia_skill_e1.description3: '''Urgot''' comes to a stop upon colliding with an enemy champion, {{tip|airborne|flinging}} them over himself and {{tip|stun|stunning}} them for {{fd|0.75}} seconds after they land.

wikia_skill_r1.name: Fear Beyond Death
wikia_skill_r1.blurb: Urgot fires a chem-drill that impales the first enemy champion hit. If that champion falls below a health threshold, Urgot judges them weak and can execute them.
wikia_skill_r1.description: {{sbc|First Cast:}} After a {{fd|0.5}}-second delay, '''Urgot''' fires a chem-drill forward that impales the first enemy champion struck, dealing {{as|physical damage}}, leashing them for 4 seconds and {{tip|slow|slowing}} them by {{as|{{pp|type=target's '''missing''' health|11|key=%|0 to 75|key1=%|0 to 75|formula=1% per 1% missing health. ''This is capped at 75%''}}|health}}.
wikia_skill_r1.description2: If the target is below {{as|{{sti|health|25% of their '''maximum''' health}}}}, ''Fear Beyond Death'' can be re-activated, and automatically does so after 4 seconds if the target is within the threshold.
wikia_skill_r1.description3: {{sbc|Second Cast:}} '''Urgot''' begins {{tip|channel|channeling}} as he launches chains at the target, {{tip|suppression|suppressing}} them and pushing them up to {{tt|1000|Estimated}} units away, after which they're reeled in over {{tt|{{fd|1.5}}|Estimated}} seconds, during which they are {{tip|untargetable}} by other effects.
wikia_skill_r1.description4: The channel can only be interrupted by '''Urgot's''' death. If the channel is successful, the target is {{as|executed|true damage}} and surrounding enemies are {{tip|flee|terrified}} for {{fd|1.5}} seconds, also {{tip|slow|slowing}} them by 75%.
wikia_skill_r1.notes:
* '''Urgot''' can move while channeling and while executing his target.
* Reactivating the ability early will reel the target as soon as they reach the {{as|25% maximum health}} threshold.
** The ability will reactivate and execute regardless of '''Urgot''' being [[Crowd control|crowd controlled]] or not, including self- or enemy-imposed {{tip|stasis}}.
* The second cast's chains are classified as projectile.
** The enemy becoming [[Untargetability|untargetable]] will prevent the chains from connecting and affecting them.
** {{ai|Black Shield|Morgana|CC-immunity}} will prevent the {{tip|suppression}} and thereby the whole effect of the chains.
** If {{cai|Unbreakable|Braum}} intercepts the projectile, he will be pulled and executed instead.
** {{tip|spell shield|Spell shields}} will '''not''' block the chains.
* When the chains start reeling in and suppressing a player's champion, chains will also cover the sides of their screen.
* Despite the tooltip, the {{tip|suppression}} can be countered by the usual means, for example: {{ii|Quicksilver Sash}} or {{ai|Remove Scurvy|Gangplank}} will remove the second effect, and crowd control immune targets will resist it entirely.
* The target will die regardless of their current health once the second cast's chains hit, even if they are healed by {{ai|Wish|Soraka}} (which can affect untargetable allies) or have a [[shield]] that persists the duration of the channel that places them above the health threshold.
** If the target has {{tip|invulnerability}} that persists the duration of the channel, it will protect them from the execution - e.g. {{ai|Undying Rage|Tryndamere}}, which can be activated during the suppression.
** The effect will also not prevent the activation of revival effects, such as {{ii|Guardian Angel}} or {{cai|Rebirth|Anivia}}.
** Despite being untargetable, {{ci|Kalista}} can still {{ai|Fate's Call|Kalista|pull her Oathsworn}} out of the execution.
** Death-triggered passives ({{cai|Death Defied|Karthus}}, {{cai|Icathian Surprise|Kog'Maw}}, and {{cai|Glory in Death|Sion}}) will be triggered.
** Only the target's current health will count as '''Urgot's''' damage in post-game statistics and [[spell vamp]] healing.
